lines.text:
[during labor]
I'm fine, except for some incredibly painful spasms which let me know that there IS a God, and He's a sexist pig!
I don't want to divorce, Micki, I just want to marry Maude.
You can't have your cake and eat it too.
I've been with her for ten years. I can't give them up just like that. And it's have your cake and eat it too.
What do you mean?
To have your cake, anyone can do. To eat it and still have some left, that's the trick.
Eat your cake, have your cake, who cares? You're about to get a plate of sauteed brains thrown into your face, your entire career is the toilet, and you're correcting my grammar?

[in the scrub room before Micki's surgery]
They know.
They know what? Who?
The Salingers. They know I worship your body like a French cathedral.
I don't care who knows, Mary. You're my woman and I'm your man!

[they kiss passionately]
Never the less, if they can keep a secret, ha ha, so can I.
[they kiss again]

[after catching the bouquet at Rob and Maude's wedding]
I guess I'm next.
Oh, I don't think he has the time.
[speaking of Rob]

[during labor]
I'll need a phone.
A phone in the labor room?
Yes, and I don't suppose I could have a stenographer in the labor room?
Come on, Micki, just one child. A small one.

[to Rob]
Oh, my God. You look like someone just took out all your blood and replaced it with milk.
Will you marry me?

[telling a spaced out Micki about Rob's infidelity]
I have some bad news, Mrs. Salinger. Dr. Fibel and I... how shall I put this. Dr. Fibel and I...
It's okay, I know.
You do?
Yes.
And you don't mind?
Why should I mind?
Frankly, I'm shocked.
What am I supposed to do cancel surgery because my doctor's having an affair with his nurse?
What?

[laughing hysterically]
You're having an affair with Dr. Fibel.
What on earth are you talking about? I'm not that kind of woman and neither is Dr. Fibel.

[Nurse Verbeck leaves the room in a huff and Rob steps in to find Micki laughing away]
Micki, Micki, is everything all right in here?
Oh, Rob, did you noticed that Nurse Verbeck is just a little bit menopausal?

[the morning after sleeping with Maude]
God, I'm so hungover, my head feels like a tuning fork.

[at the wrestling match]
Come on, Gorilla, kill that son of a bitch!
Gorilla Muldoon, is your father?
That's not his real name.

[to Rob about Maude]
You've been sleeping with her the same way Fibel's been sleeping with Verbeck!

[in the operating room]
Knock that woman out!
Get off the bed, kitty.
What am I supposed to say? "Micki, a decade is a long time to be intimate with another human being, but I'm..."
A little stiff. A little stiff, Rob. How about "Dear..."?
Dear? What do you mean "dear"? I don't call her "dear", she's a lawyer.
Oh... "Councilor"? I'm just not good enough for you.

Oh! Common, Leo... Jesus! Wait a minute. Uhm... Oh! Common, Leo... Jesus! Wait a minute. Uhm... "Sometimes in a relationship, uhm... Sometimes in a relationship things happen that neither party anticipates."
Yeah, you've got the punch, now you need the pillow.
What do you mean?
You'll gonna knock her out with this news, you need a pillow for her to land on.
Yeah, I suppose...
"Micki, I love you. I'll always love you."
Yeah.
Uhm... "These years with you, I've seen you blossom from a young girl into a mature woman."
No, no, no. I mean, she was always a mature woman, even at 25.
All right, you like the part "Micki, I love you. I'll always love you", like that, right?
Look, Leo. It's all right, but it's not exp...
Well, "Micki, I love you. I'll always love you..."
"And... and... I'm..."
"... and I've knocked up a girl, I'm gonna marry and I want a divorce."
Great, where's the pillow?
"We'd like to name the baby after you."
